meanings.sent1: The old, ugly house stood alone on the street.
meanings.sent2: She felt sad when she saw the ugly painting.
meanings.sent3: The ugly cat tried to wear a tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: The storm left an ugly scar on the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The smell from the garbage was as ugly as the sight.

meanings.sent1: His ugly behavior towards others shocked everyone.
meanings.sent2: The bully's words were truly ugly and hurtful.
meanings.sent3: It's ugly to cheat in a game; play fair!
meanings.sent4: The corruption scandal revealed the ugly truth.
meanings.sent5: The lies he told painted an ugly picture of his character.

meanings.definition: Unpleasant or disagreeable to look at
meanings.sent1: The ugly stain on the carpet ruined its beauty.
meanings.sent2: The food looked so ugly that she couldn't eat it.
meanings.sent3: The ugly sweater made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds painted an ugly sky before the storm.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the alarm clock was as ugly as its appearance.
